intro: Hieracium praetervisum, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to Europe and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and basal rosette of leaves. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. It has hairy stems and leaves that are usually lance-shaped, and its flowers are arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence. Hieracium praetervisum is known for its ability to spread through rhizomes and is considered a common weed in some regions.
